raw_text:
Half-Life 2 sweeps Bafta awards
 
 PC first person shooter Half-Life 2 has won six Bafta Awards, including best game and best online game.
 
 The title, developed by Valve, was released last year to universal acclaim - receiving special praise for its immersive plot and physics engine. The game also won Baftas for best action adventure, best PC game, art direction and animation. Burnout 3 won three awards in the categories for racing, technical direction and best PlayStation 2 game. Grant Dean, chairman of the Bafta games awards, said at a ceremony in London on Tuesday: "The last year has been a great year for the interactive entertainment industry.
 
 "These awards reflect the enormous achievements, progress and diversity that we have seen in that time." Halo 2 won the best Xbox game category, while Prince of Persia: Warrior Within was adjudged the best GameCube title. The sports award went to Konami's Pro Evolution Soccer 4. Bafta said the "significant feature" of this year's awards was the number of "non-traditional games". The originality award was won by PlayStation 2 title Singstar while the children's award went to GameCube bongo rhythm game Donkey Konga. The Handheld Award went to Colin McRae Rally 2005 while the mobile category was won by Blue Tooth Byplanes. The audio award was won by Call of Duty: Finest Hour and Hitman: Contracts won the music award.
llama3.2:1b: Half-Life 2 sweeps Bafta awards, winning six including best game and online game categories.
It also wins awards for art direction, animation, physics engine, action-adventure, PC game, and best game on Xbox.

Other winners include Halo 2, Prince of Persia: Warrior Within, Konami's Pro Evolution Soccer 4, Singstar, Donkey Konga, Colin McRae Rally 2005, Blue Tooth Byplanes, Call of Duty: Finest Hour, Hitman: Contracts, and PlayStation 2 title Burnout 3.

Burnout 3 won three awards, while other winners include Halo 2, Prince of Persia: Warrior Within, Pro Evolution Soccer 4, Singstar, Donkey Konga, Colin McRae Rally 2005, Blue Tooth Byplanes, Call of Duty: Finest Hour, Hitman: Contracts, and Blue Tooth's mobile game Blue Tooth Byplanes won.

tinydolphin:1.1b: Half-Life 2 sweeps Bafta awards, winning six prestigious prizes, including best game and best online game.

The sweeping series of awards also honored Burnout 3, winning three Bafta Awards, including best action adventure, best PC game, art direction, and animation.

With the release of Halo 2, which won best Xbox game, and Prince of Persia: Warrior Within receiving a special award for its GameCube port, this year's Bafta recognition showcases the significant achievements and progress in interactive entertainment.
The sports award went to Konami's Pro Evolution Soccer 4, while a non-traditional game, Singstar, won Best Non-Traditional Game.
This year's BAFTA Awards also recognized innovation and creativity across multiple platforms and categories, highlighting the importance of originality in winning awards.

4) Have patience as the process takes its time.
This is how the process works: You visit the website of the bank and register yourself.
Then, you will be required to provide personal information like name, address, date of birth etc.
After this, you need to choose your preferred payment method, which might include credit/debit card, net banking or cash deposit.
Once done with these steps, you are ready to proceed further.
The next step would be to fill out the necessary form(s) required for transferring funds.
This could include things like your beneficiary details (like name and address), the account number of the recipient, and the amount that you want to transfer.
Some banks may also ask for a reference number if needed.
After filling out all these forms and data, you can proceed to make the payment.
Banks usually provide several options to make payments such as debit card, credit card or net banking etc.
You need to choose your preferred option and follow the instructions given on the screen.
Finally, once everything is done, the money will be transferred from your account to the beneficiary's account.
The entire process can take anywhere between a few minutes to an hour or more depending on the bank, the amount being transferred, and other factors.

In summary, the entire process of transferring funds involves visiting the bank's website and registering yourself, filling out necessary forms, choosing payment methods, making payments, and finally receiving funds in your account.
It can be a bit time-consuming, but it's worth the effort when done correctly.

The game was praised for its immersive plot and advanced physics engine.

Other notable winners were Burnout 3 for racing, technical direction, and best PlayStation 2 game; Halo 2 for best Xbox game; Prince of Persia: Warrior Within for GameCube; Konami's Pro Evolution Soccer 4 for sports.

The originality award went to Singstar (PlayStation 2), Donkey Konga for children, Colin McRae Rally 2005 for handheld, Blue Tooth Byplanes for mobile, Call of Duty: Finest Hour for audio, and Hitman: Contracts for music.
This year's Baftas highlighted the growth and diversity in the interactive entertainment industry.
